Lord<WG2962>, they have killed<WG615> thy<WG4675> prophets<WG4396>, and<WG2532> digged down<WG2679> thine<WG4675> altars<WG2379>; and I<WG2504> am left<WG5275> alone<WG3441>, and<WG2532> they seek<WG2212> my<WG3450> life<WG5590>.

But<WG235> what<WG5101> saith<WG3004> the answer of God<WG5538> unto him<WG846>? I have reserved<WG2641> to myself<WG1683> seven thousand<WG2035> men<WG435>, who<WG3748> have<WG2578> not<WG3756> bowed<WG2578> the knee<WG1119> to the image of Baal<WG896>.
Even so<WG3779> then<WG3767> at<WG1722> this present<WG3568> time<WG2540> also<WG2532> there is<WG1096> a remnant<WG3005> according<WG2596> to the election<WG1589> of grace<WG5485>.

But<WG1161> if<WG1487> it be of<WG1537> works<WG2041>, then is it<WG2076> no more<WG2089> <WG3765> grace<WG5485>: otherwise<WG1893> work<WG2041> is<WG2076> no more<WG2089> <WG3765> work<WG2041>.

What<WG5101> then<WG3767>? Israel<WG2474> hath<WG2013> not<WG3756> obtained<WG2013> that<WG5127> which<WG3739> he seeketh for<WG1934>; but<WG1161> the election<WG1589> hath obtained it<WG2013>, and<WG1161> the rest<WG3062> were blinded<WG4456> blinded: or, hardened

(According as<WG2531> it is written<WG1125>, God<WG2316> hath given<WG1325> them<WG846> the spirit<WG4151> of slumber<WG2659>, eyes<WG3788> that they should<WG991> not<WG3361> see<WG991>, and<WG2532> ears<WG3775> that they should<WG191> not<WG3361> hear<WG191>;) unto<WG2193> this<WG4594> day<WG2250>. slumber: or, remorse

And<WG2532> David<WG1138> saith<WG3004>, Let<WG1096> their<WG846> table<WG5132> be made<WG1096> a snare<WG1519> <WG3803>, and<WG2532> a trap<WG1519> <WG2339>, and<WG2532> a stumblingblock<WG1519> <WG4625>, and<WG2532> a recompence<WG1519> <WG468> unto them<WG846>:
Let<WG4654> their<WG846> eyes<WG3788> be darkened<WG4654>, that they may<WG991> not<WG3361> see<WG991>, and<WG2532> bow down<WG4781> their<WG846> back<WG3577> alway<WG1275>.

I say<WG3004> then<WG3767>,<WG3361> Have they stumbled<WG4417> that<WG2443> they should fall<WG4098>? God forbid<WG3361> <WG1096>: but<WG235> rather through their<WG846> fall<WG3900> salvation<WG4991> is come unto the Gentiles<WG1484>, for to<WG1519> provoke<WG3863> them<WG846> to jealousy<WG3863>.

Now<WG1161> if<WG1487> the fall<WG3900> of them<WG846> be the riches<WG4149> of the world<WG2889>, and<WG2532> the diminishing<WG2275> of them<WG846> the riches<WG4149> of the Gentiles<WG1484>; how<WG4214> much more<WG3123> their<WG846> fulness<WG4138>? diminishing: or, decay, or, loss

For<WG1063> I speak<WG3004> to you<WG5213> Gentiles<WG1484>, inasmuch as<WG1909> <WG3745> <WG3303> I<WG1473> am<WG1510> the apostle<WG652> of the Gentiles<WG1484>, I magnify<WG1392> mine<WG3450> office<WG1248>:
If by any means<WG1513> <WG4458> I may provoke to emulation<WG3863> them which are my<WG3450> flesh<WG4561>, and<WG2532> might save<WG4982> some<WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846>.

For<WG1063> if<WG1487> the casting away<WG580> of them<WG846> be the reconciling<WG2643> of the world<WG2889>, what<WG5101> shall the receiving<WG4356> of them be, but<WG1508> life<WG2222> from<WG1537> the dead<WG3498>?
For<WG1161> if<WG1487> the firstfruit<WG536> be holy<WG40>, the lump<WG5445> is also<WG2532> holy: and<WG2532> if<WG1487> the root<WG4491> be holy<WG40>, so<WG2532> are the branches<WG2798>.

And<WG1161> if some<WG1536> of the branches<WG2798> be broken off<WG1575>, and<WG1161> thou<WG4771>, being<WG5607> a wild olive tree<WG65>, wert graffed in<WG1461> among<WG1722> them<WG846>, and<WG2532> with<WG4791> them<WG1096> partakest<WG4791> of the root<WG4491> and<WG2532> fatness<WG4096> of the olive tree<WG1636>; among them: or, for them

Boast<WG2620> not<WG3361> against<WG2620> the branches<WG2798>. But<WG1161> if<WG1487> thou boast<WG2620>, thou<WG4771> bearest<WG941> not<WG3756> the root<WG4491>, but<WG235> the root<WG4491> thee<WG4571>.
Thou wilt say<WG2046> then<WG3767>, The branches<WG2798> were broken off<WG1575>, that<WG2443> I<WG1473> might be graffed in<WG1461>.
Well<WG2573>; because of unbelief<WG570> they were broken off<WG1575>, and<WG1161> thou<WG4771> standest<WG2476> by faith<WG4102>. Be<WG5309> not<WG3361> highminded<WG5309>, but<WG235> fear<WG5399>:

For<WG1063> if<WG1487> God<WG2316> spared<WG5339> not<WG3756> the natural<WG5449> branches<WG2798> <WG2596>, take heed lest<WG4458> <WG3381> he<WG5339> also<WG3381> spare<WG5339> not<WG3761> thee<WG4675>.

Behold<WG1492> therefore<WG3767> the goodness<WG5544> and<WG2532> severity<WG663> of God<WG2316>: on<WG1909> them which fell<WG4098> <WG3303>, severity<WG663>; but<WG1161> toward<WG1909> thee<WG4571>, goodness<WG5544>, if<WG1437> thou continue<WG1961> in his goodness<WG5544>: otherwise<WG1893> thou<WG4771> also<WG2532> shalt be cut off<WG1581>.

And<WG1161> they<WG1565> also<WG2532>, if<WG3362> they abide<WG1961> not<WG3362> still in unbelief<WG570>, shall be graffed in<WG1461>: for<WG1063> God<WG2316> is<WG2076> able<WG1415> to graff<WG1461> them<WG846> in<WG1461> again<WG3825>.

For<WG1063> if<WG1487> thou<WG4771> wert cut<WG1581> out of<WG1537> the olive tree which is wild<WG65> by<WG2596> nature<WG5449>, and<WG2532> wert graffed<WG1461> contrary to<WG3844> nature<WG5449> into<WG1519> a good olive tree<WG2565>: how much<WG4214> more<WG3123> shall these<WG3778>, which be the natural<WG2596> <WG5449> branches, be graffed into<WG1461> their own<WG2398> olive tree<WG1636>?

For<WG1063> I would<WG2309> not<WG3756>, brethren<WG80>, that ye<WG5209> should be ignorant<WG50> of this<WG5124> mystery<WG3466>, lest<WG3363> ye should be<WG5600> wise<WG5429> in<WG3844> your own conceits<WG1438>; that<WG3754> blindness<WG4457> in<WG575> part<WG3313> is happened<WG1096> to Israel<WG2474>, until<WG891> <WG3739> the fulness<WG4138> of the Gentiles<WG1484> be come in<WG1525>. blindness: or, hardness

And<WG2532> so<WG3779> all<WG3956> Israel<WG2474> shall be saved<WG4982>: as<WG2531> it is written<WG1125>, There shall come<WG2240> out of<WG1537> Sion<WG4622> the Deliverer<WG4506>, and<WG2532> shall turn away<WG654> ungodliness<WG763> from<WG575> Jacob<WG2384>:
For<WG2532> this<WG3778> is my<WG3844> <WG1700> covenant<WG1242> unto them<WG846>, when<WG3752> I shall take away<WG851> their<WG846> sins<WG266>.

As concerning<WG2596> <WG3303> the gospel<WG2098>, they are enemies<WG2190> for your sakes<WG1223> <WG5209>: but<WG1161> as touching<WG2596> the election<WG1589>, they are beloved<WG27> for<WG1223> the fathers'<WG3962> sakes<WG1223>.

For<WG3754> of<WG1537> him<WG846>, and<WG2532> through<WG1223> him<WG846>, and<WG2532> to<WG1519> him<WG846>, are all things<WG3956>: to whom<WG846> be glory<WG1391> for<WG1519> ever<WG165>. Amen<WG281>. whom: Gr. him
